text.div:
Generated Narrative: ConceptMap RouteOfAdministrationEDQMToCdTyp26

Mapping from EDQM - RouteOfAdministration to https://index.hcisolutions.ch/index/current/get.aspx?schema=CODE&keytype=CDTYP&key=26


Group 1 Mapping from EDQM - Standard Terms to https://index.hcisolutions.ch/index/current/get.aspx?schema=CODE&keytype=CDTYP&key=26 (CHEMEDEPRHCIIndexCdTyp26NamingSystem)

Source CodeRelationshipTarget CodeComment
20001000 (Auricular use)has specializationOT (Auricular (instillation))The source code is any auricular use, while the target code is specifically auricular use by means of instillation. There is no other auricular use code in CdTyp26.
20002500 (Buccal use)is equal toBUC (Buccal)
20003000 (Cutaneous use)is equal toSKIN (Topical)
20004000 (Dental use)is equal toDEN (Dental)
20006000 (Endocervical use)is equal toENDOZERV (Endocervical)
20007000 (Endosinusial use)is equal toENDOSINUS (Endosinusial)
20008000 (Endotracheopulmonary use)is equivalent toET (Endotracheal)The source code is defined as endotracheopulmanory use, while the target code is endotracheal use.
20009000 (Epidural use)has specializationEPI (Epidural (infusion))The source code is any epidural use, while the target code is specifically epidural use by means of infusion.
20009000 (Epidural use)has specializationEPIDURINJ (Epidural (injection))The source code is any epidural use, while the target code is specifically epidural use by means of injection.
20010000 (Epilesional use)is equal toEPILESION (Epilesional)
20011000 (Extraamniotic use)is equivalent toEXTAMNIOINJ (Extraamniotic)
20011500 (Extracorporeal use)is equal toEXTCORP (Extracorporeal)
20087000 (Extrapleural use)has specializationEXTPLRINFUS (Extrapleural (instillation))The source code is any injection of a medicinal product directly outside the pleural cavity, while the target code is specifically extrapleural use by means of an instillation. There is no other extrapleural use code in CdTyp26.
20013000 (Gastroenteral use)has specializationGT (Gastrointestinal (instillation))The source code is any gastroenteral use, while the target code is specifically gastrointestinal use by means of instillation. There is no other gastroenteral use code in CdTyp26.
20013500 (Gastric use)has specializationIGASTINSTIL (Intragastric (instillation))The source code is any gastric use, while the target code is specifically intragastric use by means of instillation. There is no other gastric use code in CdTyp26.
20014000 (Gingival use)is equal toGI (Gingival)
20015000 (Haemodialysis)is equivalent toHEMODIFF (Haemodialysis (diffusion))
20015500 (Implantation)is equivalent toIMPLANTINSE (Implantation (insertion))
20019500 (Infiltration)is equal toINFILTINJ (Infiltration (injection))
20020000 (Inhalation use)is equivalent toORINHL (Oral (inhalation))EDQM excludes nasal use from the inhalation use code.
20021000 (Intestinal use)maps loosely toGT (Gastrointestinal (instillation))The source code is any intestinal use, while the target code is any gastrointestinal use by means of instillation. There is no other intestinal use code in CdTyp26.
20022000 (Intraamniotic use)is equivalent toIAMNIOINJ (Intraamniotic (injection))
20023000 (Intraarterial use)has specializationIA (Intraarterial (infusion))The source code is any intraarterial use, while the target code is specifically intraarterial use by means of infusion.
20023000 (Intraarterial use)has specializationIAINJ (Intraarterial (injection))The source code is any intraarterial use, while the target code is specifically auricular use by means of injection.
20024000 (Intraarticular use)is equal toIARTINJ (Intraarticular)
20025000 (Intrabursal use)is equal toIBURSINJ (Intrabursal)
20025500 (Intracameral use)is equal toIKAMERAL (Intracameral)
20026000 (Intracardiac use)is equivalent toICARDINJ (Intracardiac (injection))
20026500 (Intracartilaginous use)is equal toIKARTILAG (Intracartilaginous)
20027000 (Intracavernous use)is equal toICORPCAVINJ (Intracavernous)
20027010 (Intracerebral use)is equal toICEREBRAL (Intracerebral)
20028000 (Intracervical use)is equivalent toICERVICAL (Intracervical (injection))
20028300 (Intracholangiopancreatic use)is equivalent toICHOLANGIOP (Intracholangiopancreatic (injection))
20028500 (Intracisternal use)is equal toICISTERN (Intracisternal)
20029000 (Intracoronary use)is equivalent toICORONINJ (Intracoronary (injection))
20030000 (Intradermal use)is equivalent toIDINJ (Intradermal (injection))
20031000 (Intradiscal use)is equivalent toIDISCINJ (Intradiscal (injection))
20031500 (Intraepidermal use)is equal toIEPIDERMAL (Intraepidermal)
20031700 (Intraglandular use)is equivalent toIGLANDINJ (Intraglandular (injection))
20032000 (Intralesional use)is equal toILES (Intralesional)
20033000 (Intralymphatic use)is equal toILYMPJINJ (Intralymphatic)
20035000 (Intramuscular use)is equivalent toIM (Intramuscular (injection))
20036000 (Intraocular use)has specializationIOINJ (Intraocular (injection))The source code is any intraocular use, while the target code is specifically intraocular use by means of injection.
20036000 (Intraocular use)has specializationIOINSTIL (Intraocular (instillation))The source code is any intraocular use, while the target code is specifically intraocular use by means of instillation.
20036500 (Intraosseous use)is equivalent toIOSSINJ (Intraosseous (injection))
20037000 (Intrapericardial use)is equivalent toIPERICARDIN (Intrapericardial (injection))
20038000 (Intraperitoneal use)is equal toIPDP (Intraperitoneal)
20039000 (Intrapleural use)is equal toIPLRINJ (Intrapleural)
20039200 (Intraportal use)has specializationIPORTAL (Intraportal (infusion))The source code is any intraportal use, while the target code is specifically intraportal use by means of infusion.
20039200 (Intraportal use)has specializationIPORTALINJ (Intraportal (injection))The source code is any intraportal use, while the target code is specifically intraportal use by means of injection.
20039500 (Intraprostatic use)is equal toIPROSTAT (Intraprostatic)
20041000 (Intrasternal use)is equivalent toISTERNALINJ (Intrasternal (injection))
20042000 (Intrathecal use)has specializationIT (Intrathecal (infusion))The source code is any intrathecal use, while the target code is specifically intrathecal use by means of infusion.
20042000 (Intrathecal use)has specializationITINJ (Intrathecal (injection))The source code is any intrathecal use, while the target code is specifically intrathecal use by means of injection.
20043000 (Intratumoral use)is equal toITUMINJ (Intratumoral)
20044000 (Intrauterine use)has specializationIU (Intrauterine (insertion))The source code is any intrauterine use, while the target code is specifically intrauterine use by means of insertion. Arguably, an insertion in EDQM would be an "Implantation" use, instead of an intrauterine use, so the this mapping element could be ignored.
20044000 (Intrauterine use)has specializationIUINJ (Intrauterine (injection))The source code is any intrauterine use, while the target code is specifically intrauterine use by means of injection.
20045000 (Intravenous use)has specializationIV (Intravenous (infusion))The source code is any intravenous use, while the target code is specifically intravenous use by means of infusion.
20045000 (Intravenous use)has specializationIVINJ (Intravenous (injection))The source code is any intravenous use, while the target code is specifically intravenous use by means of injection.
20046000 (Intravesical use)has specializationBLADINJ (Intravesical (injection))The source code is any intravesical use, while the target code is specifically intravesical use by means of injection.
20046000 (Intravesical use)has specializationBLADINSTL (Intravesical (instillation))The source code is any intravesical use, while the target code is specifically intravesical use by means of instillation.
20047000 (Intravitreal use)has specializationIVITINJ (Intravitreal (injection))The source code is any intravitreal use, while the target code is specifically intravitreal use by means of injection. There is no other intravitreal use code in CdTyp26.
20047500 (Iontophoresis)is equal toIONTOPHORES (Iontophoresis)
20048000 (Laryngopharyngeal use)is equal toLARYNGOPHAR (Laryngopharingeal)
20049000 (Nasal use)is equivalent toNASAL
20051000 (Ocular use)is equal toOPTHALTA (Ophthalmic)
20053000 (Oral use)is equivalent toPO (Peroral (swallow))Note that, while EDQM has only a oral code for swallowing a medication, CdTyp26 has more granularity and allows to specify oral uses via chewing or sucking, which ultimatiately would be swallowed.
20054000 (Oromucosal use)is equivalent toORMUC (Oromucosal)
20055000 (Oropharyngeal use)has specializationGARGLE (Oropharyngeal (gargle))The source code is any oropharyngeal use, while the target code is specifically oropharyngeal use by means of gargling.
20055000 (Oropharyngeal use)has specializationOROPHARTA (Oropharyngeal (spray))The source code is any oropharyngeal use, while the target code is specifically oropharyngeal use by means of spraying a medicinal product.
20057000 (Periarticular use)is equal toPAINJ (Periarticular)
20058000 (Perineural use)has specializationPNINFUS (Perineural (infusion))The source code is any perineural use, while the target code is specifically perineural use by means of infusion.
20058000 (Perineural use)has specializationPNINJ (Perineural (injection))The source code is any perineural use, while the target code is specifically perineural use by means of injection.
20059000 (Periodontal use)is equal toPDONTTA (Periodontal)
20059300 (Periosseous use)is equal toPERIOSS (Periosseous)
20059400 (Peritumoral use)is equal toPTINJ (Peritumoral)
20059500 (Posterior juxtascleral use)is equal toPOSTJUXTASC (Posterior juxtascleral)
20061000 (Rectal use)is equal toRECTAL
20061500 (Retrobulbar use)has specializationRBINJ (Retrobulbar (injection))The source code is any retrobulbar use, while the target code is specifically retrobulbar use by means of instillation. There is no other retrobulbar use code in CdTyp26.
20062000 (Route of administration not applicable)(not mapped)
20063000 (Skin scarification)is equivalent toSCARIFICAT (Scarification)
20065000 (Subconjunctival use)is equivalent toSCINJ (Subconjunctival (injection))
20066000 (Subcutaneous use)has specializationSQ (Subcutaneous (injection))The source code is any subcuteaneous use, understood as the injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, while the target code is specifically subcutaneous use by means of injection.
20066000 (Subcutaneous use)maps loosely toSQIMPLNT (Subcutaneous (implantation))While the source code is any subcuteaneous use, understood as the injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, EDQM has a different code for Implantation as a route of administration.
20066000 (Subcutaneous use)has specializationSQINFUS (Subcutaneous (infusion))The source code is any subcutaneous use, while the target code is specifically subcutaneous use by means of infusion. EDQM routes of administration do not make a difference between injection and infusion.
20067000 (Sublingual use)is equal toSL (Sublingual)
20067500 (Submucosal use)is equivalent toSUBMUCINJ (Submucosal (injection))
20070000 (Transdermal use)is equal toTRNSDERMD (Transdermal)
20071000 (Urethral use)has specializationURETHINJ (Urethral (injection))The source code is any urethral use, while the target code is specifically urethral use by means of injection.
20071000 (Urethral use)has specializationURETHINSTL (Urethral (instillation))The source code is any urethral use, while the target code is specifically urethral use by means of instillation.
20072000 (Vaginal use)is equal toVAGINS (Vaginal)
20080000 (Intracerebroventricular use)is equal toIVENTCERE (Cerebral intraverticular)
20081000 (Subretinal use)has specializationSRINJ (Subretinal (injection))The source code is any subretinal use, while the target code is specifically subretinal use by means of injection. There is no other subretinal use code in CdTyp26.
20084000 (Intracorneal use)is equal toICORNEAL (Intracorneal)
20086000 (Intraputaminal use)is equal toIPUTAMINAL (Intraputaminal)

name: RouteOfAdministrationEDQMToCdTyp26
title: RouteOfAdministrationEDQM -> CdTyp26
description: Mapping from RouteOfAdministrationEDQM route of administration codes to HCI CdTyp26 codes.
purpose:
This concept map provides guidance for implementers that use HCI Index product(s) internally to translate EDQM codes for routes of administration as used by the eMedication service to the HCI CdTyp26 equivalent.

This concept map does not - and could not possibly - provide a one to one match for every source code. Whenever possible, comments in this concept map provide further guidance on how to approach the translation of problematic items.

target.comment: The source code is any auricular use, while the target code is specifically auricular use by means of instillation. There is no other auricular use code in CdTyp26.
The source code is defined as endotracheopulmanory use, while the target code is endotracheal use.
The source code is any epidural use, while the target code is specifically epidural use by means of infusion.
The source code is any epidural use, while the target code is specifically epidural use by means of injection.

The source code is any injection of a medicinal product directly outside the pleural cavity, while the target code is specifically extrapleural use by means of an instillation. There is no other extrapleural use code in CdTyp26.
The source code is any gastroenteral use, while the target code is specifically gastrointestinal use by means of instillation. There is no other gastroenteral use code in CdTyp26.
The source code is any gastric use, while the target code is specifically intragastric use by means of instillation. There is no other gastric use code in CdTyp26.
EDQM excludes nasal use from the inhalation use code.
The source code is any intestinal use, while the target code is any gastrointestinal use by means of instillation. There is no other intestinal use code in CdTyp26.
The source code is any intraarterial use, while the target code is specifically intraarterial use by means of infusion.
The source code is any intraarterial use, while the target code is specifically auricular use by means of injection.
The source code is any intraocular use, while the target code is specifically intraocular use by means of injection.
The source code is any intraocular use, while the target code is specifically intraocular use by means of instillation.
The source code is any intraportal use, while the target code is specifically intraportal use by means of infusion.
The source code is any intraportal use, while the target code is specifically intraportal use by means of injection.
The source code is any intrathecal use, while the target code is specifically intrathecal use by means of infusion.
The source code is any intrathecal use, while the target code is specifically intrathecal use by means of injection.

The source code is any intrauterine use, while the target code is specifically intrauterine use by means of insertion. Arguably, an insertion in EDQM would be an "Implantation" use, instead of an intrauterine use, so the this mapping element could be ignored.
The source code is any intrauterine use, while the target code is specifically intrauterine use by means of injection.
The source code is any intravenous use, while the target code is specifically intravenous use by means of infusion.
The source code is any intravenous use, while the target code is specifically intravenous use by means of injection.
The source code is any intravesical use, while the target code is specifically intravesical use by means of injection.
The source code is any intravesical use, while the target code is specifically intravesical use by means of instillation.
The source code is any intravitreal use, while the target code is specifically intravitreal use by means of injection. There is no other intravitreal use code in CdTyp26.
Note that, while EDQM has only a oral code for swallowing a medication, CdTyp26 has more granularity and allows to specify oral uses via chewing or sucking, which ultimatiately would be swallowed.
The source code is any oropharyngeal use, while the target code is specifically oropharyngeal use by means of gargling.
The source code is any oropharyngeal use, while the target code is specifically oropharyngeal use by means of spraying a medicinal product.
The source code is any perineural use, while the target code is specifically perineural use by means of infusion.
The source code is any perineural use, while the target code is specifically perineural use by means of injection.
The source code is any retrobulbar use, while the target code is specifically retrobulbar use by means of instillation. There is no other retrobulbar use code in CdTyp26.

The source code is any subcuteaneous use, understood as the injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, while the target code is specifically subcutaneous use by means of injection.

While the source code is any subcuteaneous use, understood as the injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, EDQM has a different code for Implantation as a route of administration.

The source code is any subcutaneous use, while the target code is specifically subcutaneous use by means of infusion. EDQM routes of administration do not make a difference between injection and infusion.
The source code is any urethral use, while the target code is specifically urethral use by means of injection.
The source code is any urethral use, while the target code is specifically urethral use by means of instillation.
The source code is any subretinal use, while the target code is specifically subretinal use by means of injection. There is no other subretinal use code in CdTyp26.
